intro: Bulbine inamarxiae, commonly known as the Cape bulbous plant, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant is often found in rocky or sandy soils, thriving in well-drained environments. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of about 30 centimeters. The flowers bloom in spring, adding a vibrant touch to its natural habitat.
